ratings.comment: Very irresponsible and though grader. If you want to save your GPA, you should be either lucky, or choose another instructor
Horrible instructor. Drop this courses when I saw a low scores in the first project and the description of the second. No chance to improve if you do badly in the first one
Mean grader. Grade assessments very slowly. Also homework has a slight weight. Good luck!
If you are painful to do group project, consider 340 rather than this course. Both he and TA are detrimental
Most awful instructor I met at UW-Madison. STAT 340 can be better

Randomly assigned group project, hard interview questions —no all of us want to get a DS job! The second project / interview are harder. He doesn't give chance who work hard in the second half of course to success. Avoid and change major!
Randomly assigned group for an easy project. Creating interview exams this year to deflate grades. Maybe he was good before this semester

You are highly recommended to find a fortune-teller before taking his course as 100 out of 160 points come from a group project. This first one is easy but you need to make sure your randomly assigned members are fine. The second one is pretty hard. Also hold "ds interview", which is I dislike. Your grade depends on luck

Amazing lecturer. He knows stats, thinks fast and speaks fast, but not really hard to follow. He is also willing to help his students in OH and after class. This course is graded mostly based on the group project might sound scary, but we all get an A.

This prof. is really disappointing, even I can say the most terrible one I've met in Wisconsin. He never give clear grading criteria, all the grades based only on the results of randomized team jobs, I am just curious how he judges us? The final grades are unfair and no explanation given. Wondering why I spent much money learn nothing from him.

Knowledgeable, inspiring instructor; friendly, always willing to help. Have material fleshed out, the tradeoff is sometimes could be fast paced if you are very new to the related subjects. But he will walk you through during OH if you have any question. No matter you care more about grade or the content, it's a must-take. Highly recommend.

Sooo good at making complex concepts clear!! Knowledgeable on the topics, and often time bring advanced level material into class with understandable language. His html notes (generated from Rmarkdown) are definitely the coding model I want to learn from.
Greatest prof in stat dep.
Relies heavily on statistics and dislikes machine learning work.

Professor is unaware that the data science course is a combination of machine learning and statistics. He only wants statistical answers for everything. If you follow the rubric, you will not get full credit unless it is essentially what he imagined the outcome to be. Did not learn much due to group projects being randomly assigned.
A STANFORD genius! He's one of the very best and gives you great feedback. The class is a lot of work but definitely very beneficial for the long run!

Best stat professor ever. The course is well organized, and the materials are very useful. Prof Kang is super nice and knowledgeable, and he is accessible outside of the class. Talking with him(course materials, future career, course selection, etc) is always helpful. 100% recommend.

BEST PROFESSOR IN UW MADISON EVER!!!!
Very organized lectures and lecture notes, super friendly, super smart, super helpful.

Prof Kang's lectures are the best in UW- Madison so far and he is always willing to help students. He has lots of experience with big tech companies such as google and Facebook and students can learn a lot from what he teaches. Always available outside of class although he is very busy with research projects. Definitely recommend!!

Professor Kang is the best professor I have had at UW yet. Grading consists of max score from (project 1, project2) + 4 problem sets. If you were happy with your grade on project 1, he made it optional to do project 2. He does a great job of making it more about learning real world material for careers in Data Science than on nonsense busy work.
His notes and teachings are very clear and easy to follow. The grading system is very flexible as well. First amazing statistics professor I've had a UW-Madison!!!! Highly recommend

I like this professor, the course is really helpful if you want to find a data science related job, but the stupid course arrangement in our program makes lots of us lack time to really do well on everything.
His projects are really helpful. Learnt lots of great stuff from his class.

Engaging lectures, manageable workload, but the highlight of the course are the two projects. You learn more through doing the projects than reading textbooks/doing problems,something other classes should do. A must-take for stats majors or anyone looking to get into data science/machine learning.
Professor Kang is hilarious and always gives real world examples of how regression is used in the real world. I was engaged throughout the class.

The class was based off of 2 exams. Prof. Kang knows how to make the subject matter interesting and gives students a chance to improve their grade while still expecting a lot out of students. Very great teacher!
He is the most outstanding professor I have had at UW-Madison. He cares that his students learn and are able to use the material in their future endeavors. I recommend any class he is teaching.

Prof Kang is very good at teaching. Nice examples, detailed explanations and useful practical tricks make this course really helpful. The grading is pretty interesting too - max(exam1, exam2) + max(project1, project2). He randomly assigned groups for project1. The second project is a Kaggle competition, which is super fun and exciting.

Prof. Kang is incredibly knowledgable about the material. Because of his past industry experience, he provides some really valuable insight into what employers are looking for. The class is not too difficult, and the projects that he assigns are super interesting and relevant. One of the best professors I've had at UW.

Prof. Kang has so much experience in industry and uses really interesting and relevant motivating examples in class. He asks us common interview questions in the data science field that are relevant to what we are learning. It's honestly my favorite class and he's my favorite stat professor I've had. Also the projects are really interesting.
